author: @TheMartiScott
title: New Day Cafe: Keepin' Warm With Friends
text: Good morning, Cafe! Hope everyone is safe and well and warm! The cold weather is being downright mean to entirely too many of us, so please to get yourself a hot drink, something tasty and cuddle up to join us for a bit. All are welcome to join the fun, the silliness, the conversations. If you don‚Äôt know...just ask! Some things really do require a bit of explanation. There will be a few surprises along the way, all good ones, we hope. We are here to keep building the Daily Kos Community. We post Mon-Sun at 10:30 a.m. Eastern. Pie fights will be met with outrageous ridicule and insults. Trolls will be incinerated and served at the next group BBQ. As briquettes. All are welcome to join the fun, the silliness, the conversations. If you don‚Äôt know...just ask! Some things really do require a bit of explanation. There will be a few surprises along the way, all good ones, we hope. We are here to keep building the Daily Kos Community. We post Mon-Sun at 10:30 a.m. Eastern. Pie fights will be met with outrageous ridicule and insults. Trolls will be incinerated and served at the next group BBQ. As briquettes. . Who else needed this today? üòÇüîä Sound up! pic.twitter.com/2m8nYdIuc4‚Äî Jessi üí´ (@its_jessi_grace) January 12, 2024 Who else needed this today? üòÇüîä Sound up! pic.twitter.com/2m8nYdIuc4 Meanwhile‚Ä¶.They say the sea is cold, but the sea contains the hottest blood of all, and the wildest, the most urgent. All the whales in the wider deeps, hot are they, as they urge on and on, and dive beneath the icebergs. Whales weep not. WHALE, HELLO THERE: A whale put on a show off the coast of Norway and gave a group on a whale-watching tour an experience they'll never forget. https://t.co/qqieg18hwJ pic.twitter.com/nUSF7CjTQH‚Äî ABC News (@ABC) January 13, 2024 WHALE, HELLO THERE: A whale put on a show off the coast of Norway and gave a group on a whale-watching tour an experience they'll never forget. https://t.co/qqieg18hwJ pic.twitter.com/nUSF7CjTQH Archeologists have uncovered a cluster of lost cities in the Amazon rainforest that was home to at least 10,000 farmers around 2,000 years ago. https://t.co/z2IxWI3Bv0‚Äî WJZ | CBS Baltimore (@wjz) January 13, 2024 Archeologists have uncovered a cluster of lost cities in the Amazon rainforest that was home to at least 10,000 farmers around 2,000 years ago. https://t.co/z2IxWI3Bv0 NEWS: Greece Reopens the Palace Where Alexander the Great Was Crowned. https://t.co/1ZVwgnIfEH pic.twitter.com/inU95UbyC5‚Äî World History Encyclopedia (@whencyclopedia) January 13, 2024 NEWS: Greece Reopens the Palace Where Alexander the Great Was Crowned. https://t.co/1ZVwgnIfEH pic.twitter.com/inU95UbyC5 The end of an era‚Ä¶.I remember watching Bill on Days Of Our Lives when I was in high school. As a matter of fact, it was his storyline with Addie that I first remember. My mum started watching because Days came on right after the news at lunch time. Then, she had the nerve to get ME hooked on it! LOL We talked about it for years afterward, if I wasn‚Äôt working and had to miss it. Or, she‚Äôd watch it and bring me up to speed. Bill Hayes was the first to sing on a Soap, too! Days of Our Lives Star Bill Hayes Dead at 98: His 'Indelible Legacy Will Live On in Our Hearts' https://t.co/R1yEpMsx5M via @people‚Äî Mynameis...Miro (@zg4ever) January 13, 2024 Days of Our Lives Star Bill Hayes Dead at 98: His 'Indelible Legacy Will Live On in Our Hearts' https://t.co/R1yEpMsx5M via @people The Tyrannosaurus rex seemingly came out of nowhere tens of millions of years ago, with its monstrous teeth and powerful jaws dominating the end of the age of the dinosaurs. https://t.co/gIjaWInRRY‚Äî WJZ | CBS Baltimore (@wjz) January 12, 2024 The Tyrannosaurus rex seemingly came out of nowhere tens of millions of years ago, with its monstrous teeth and powerful jaws dominating the end of the age of the dinosaurs. https://t.co/gIjaWInRRY And what it took to save the iconic film prop for a new exhibit‚Äîhint: lots of steam. https://t.co/eS84BnLiQI‚Äî Atlas Obscura (@atlasobscura) January 12, 2024 And what it took to save the iconic film prop for a new exhibit‚Äîhint: lots of steam. https://t.co/eS84BnLiQI ‚ö™Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏èChaise lounge ca. 1923 Designed by Uno √Öhr√©n for Mobilia, Sweden ‚ö™Ô∏è has a scalloped shell look doesn‚Äôt it‚ö™Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/ICSluQpsAE‚Äî Michael (@MichaelisNOLA) January 13, 2024 ‚ö™Ô∏è‚ñ´Ô∏èChaise lounge ca. 1923 Designed by Uno √Öhr√©n for Mobilia, Sweden ‚ö™Ô∏è has a scalloped shell look doesn‚Äôt it‚ö™Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/ICSluQpsAE

author: varkaha
title: #140 Pablo Iglesias pide el voto para el BNG y aconseja a la militancia de Podemos que rechace el acuerdo con Yolanda Diaz
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#93](c93#c-93) Pocas cosas m√°s entretenidas que hace unas horas me llames sectario por decir que deber√≠an ir juntos, o no ir y pedir el voto por el BNG...
Y os veo a los cuatro de siempre haciendo campa√±a por el BNG ma√±ana mismo si hace falta.
[#107](c107#c-107) Es imposible mantener un di√°logo contigo.
"El no sectario ha hablado.
Que hables de que solo hay gente de un lado poniendo palos en la rueda deja todo meridianamente claro"
inscritos-podemos-galicia-decidiran-concurren-no-sumar/c014#c-14 [#77](c77#c-77) tambi√©n hay un perfil de votante de izquierda gallego que no creo que est√© contento solo con BNG y PSOE y que quiz√° deje de votar
Ese votante del que hablas est√° muy escaldado por haber votado a esa confluencia (Anova+Podemos+EU) y que, despu√©s de un buen resultado (2016), hayan acabado como el rosario de la aurora y que en 2020 no hayan sacado ni un solo diputado. Adem√°s de eso, de tener las alcald√≠as de Ferrol, Santiago y A Coru√±a, a pasar a cero concejales. A ese votante no creo que lo volviesen a pillar. Tiene que escoger entre BNG y PSdG. No queda otra.
[#101](c101#c-101) Yo los vot√©, y de lo que qued√© escaldado fue de que sacasen un buen resultado y comenzasen a dividirse a lo loco. En las pasadas auton√≥micas era un verdadero cachondeo eso de que En Marea decidiese presentarse a ver si ara√±aba algo y que Podemos simplemente jugase a no desaparecer. Si les presentas una opci√≥n seria como fueron AGE o En Marea en su momento pueden volver a captarlos. Si se presentan Sumar, Anova y Podemos cada uno por su cuenta van a sacar 0 todos.
[#15](c15#c-15) Valla mierda de escusa.
No llega ni a justificaci√≥n.
¬øQue tendr√≠amos que decir, si la derecha, recordase lo de el GAL como hace la izquierda con esa foto?
Me la suda podemos y sumar y eso. Me la suda la independencia de Galicia, pero la opci√≥n real es el BNG. Est√°n muy cerca (no) de esca√±os y de arrebatar el poder al PP.
[#96](c96#c-96) jaja he tenido que mirar a quien te referias, pero vamos son del mismo grupo, imagino que podria ser hasta un par con tropecientos clones, porque todos dicen y se comportan igual.
A m√≠ modo de ver,se juegan quien va a liderar el futuro gobierno pero descartar a sumar como posible mediador puede dejarlos en las puertas.El bng tiene un techo en votos dif√≠cil de superar a menos que convenza votantes del pp y que no le da para gobernar.El psdg est√° muy fuerte con besteiro pero cu√°ntos votantes arrastra es un m√≠ster.El PP est√° muy preocupado por Jacome.De todos modos presenta un apoderado de un feijoo escapista,muy mediocre y que repite sus mismas mentiras, mentiras que har√≠an re√≠r sino fuera porque con ellas sus votantes hunden Galicia

author: VNExplorer
title: Parents ask for medical cannabis to treat children with severe epilepsy - but are offered brain surgery by the NHS first
text:
Several families say their children were offered the 'insanely invasive procedure'
Children with severe epilepsy have been offered brain surgery by the NHS before medicinal cannabis, parents have revealed.
Several families have told the Mail their children were offered the ‚Äòinsanely invasive procedure‚Äô which involves detaching one side of the brain from the other and can cause sight loss.
One mother declined the operation, which costs the NHS up to ¬£33,400, and requested medicinal cannabis oil ‚Äì which was legalised five years ago and has proven effective with epileptic children.
The oils are administered orally every day and three children in the UK have NHS prescriptions, with successful results.
But other youngsters with similar conditions have been denied it, leaving parents paying up to ¬£2,000 a month to get the drug privately, while others can‚Äôt access it at all.
Luci Griffin‚Äôs son Alfie, 13, (pictured together) was diagnosed with intractable epilepsy six years ago and the family have so far been denied medicinal cannabis on the NHS. But last year doctors offered to carry out a hemispherotomy on Alfie, which would involve temporarily removing a piece of his skull to operate on his brain
The family are currently buying a high-concentrate CBD oil online, which costs them ¬£300 a month, but Alfie‚Äôs condition isn‚Äôt improving. He can no longer go to school and Mrs Griffin has had to stop work to become a full-time carer (stock photo of cannabis concentrate oil)
Luci Griffin‚Äôs son Alfie, 13, was diagnosed with intractable epilepsy six years ago and the family have so far been denied medicinal cannabis on the NHS.
But last year doctors offered to carry out a hemispherotomy on Alfie, which would involve temporarily removing a piece of his skull to operate on his brain.
The family said they were warned it carried ‚Äòa risk to life‚Äô, that Alfie could lose his peripheral vision and would need weeks of rehabilitation to learn to walk again.
Mrs Griffin said: ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt want to have to turn to him and say we know it didn‚Äôt work‚Ä¶ I want to say we‚Äôve done everything Alf, we did everything we could ‚Äì why wouldn‚Äôt we try medicinal cannabis first?‚Äô
The family, from Peterborough, have been refused Epidiolex on the NHS and private clinics that prescribe other oils cannot help.
In October the Mail revealed two families were smuggling cannabis oil from the Netherlands back in suitcases as the pharmacy which delivered their private prescription didn‚Äôt have enough stock.
Mrs Griffin said getting the drug privately may not even be an option as they would struggle to keep up with large monthly payments.
‚ÄòEven if we could [get it privately], how long can we sustain ¬£2,000 a month? Not for long because we‚Äôd have to sell the house,‚Äô the mother said.
The family are currently buying a high-concentrate CBD oil online, which costs them ¬£300 a month, but Alfie‚Äôs condition isn‚Äôt improving. He can no longer go to school and Mrs Griffin has had to stop work to become a full-time carer.
She said: ‚ÄòWe are absolutely stuck. We‚Äôre alone. We have no support.‚Äô
Families say they pay anything between ¬£400 to ¬£2,000 a month to get medicinal cannabis privately (stock photo of a scientist checking hemp plants in a greenhouse)
The Mail has spoken to two other families whose epileptic children were offered brain surgery.
‚ÄòYou can‚Äôt reverse brain surgery, so it seems like madness,‚Äô one mother said.
Caroline Gisbourne‚Äôs son Mitchell, 16, had the procedure before medicinal cannabis was legalised in 2018 but it didn‚Äôt work and is now successfully using the oils.
She said: ‚ÄòIf I had known about medicinal cannabis oils before, there‚Äôs no way I would have put him through the operation.‚Äô
Costs of brain surgery to the NHS depend on patients‚Äô age and the complexity of the procedure but are typically ¬£7,800 to ¬£33,400.
Families say they pay anything between ¬£400 to ¬£2,000 a month to get medicinal cannabis privately.
An NHS England spokesman said: ‚ÄòThe decision to proceed with surgery‚Ä¶ would be a joint one taken by a clinical team and a patient‚Äôs family and/or carers.‚Äô

author: Agence France-Presse
title: Ukraien President Volodymyr Zelensky On Sweden Joining NATO
text:
Source: NDTV News | Title: \‚ÄùOne More Protected From Russian Evil\‚Äù: Zelensky On Sweden Joining NATO
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday welcomed Sweden‚Äôs accession to NATO.
Kyiv:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Thursday welcomed Sweden‚Äôs accession to NATO, which his own country is hoping to join after the war ends.
The Swedish move was spurred by Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine and turned the page on two centuries of non-alignment.
‚ÄúToday, it is important to note that one more country in Europe has become more protected from Russian evil,‚Äù Zelensky said in his evening address.
Russia has vowed ‚Äúcountermeasures‚Äù over Sweden‚Äôs entry into NATO, especially if the alliance‚Äôs troops and assets deploy in the country.
‚ÄúAt a time of Russian aggression‚Ä¶ everyone sees how important it is to maintain alliances and partnerships,‚Äù Zelensky added.
He has been pushing allies for a timetable to join the NATO ranks once the Russian invasion has been defeated.
Leaders have agreed that Ukraine could join the alliance once peace has been restored, but insisted certain conditions should be met.
‚ÄúThere will be a day when Sweden will be able to congratulate Ukraine on joining the alliance as well,‚Äù Zelensky said.
(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
Read More | Source: NDTV News

author: Jonathan Rich Staff Writer
title: Gov. Cooper visits hurricane-damaged Pisgah Forest | News | transylvaniatimes.com
text:
Friday morning Gov. Roy Cooper made his first trip to Transylvania County to visit people and businesses impacted by Hurricane Helene and shared the message that his administration and federal disaster officials are here to help.
‚ÄúThis is a unique and devastating disaster that has occurred here,‚Äù Cooper said. ‚ÄúI know there are thousands of assessments that have already been made. Assessments of damages leads to quicker recovery and that work is ongoing. We‚Äôve been here to assist, but it‚Äôs going to be the strength of the local people in western North Carolina that‚Äôs going to be the heart of this recovery.‚Äù
Cooper toured Pisgah Fish Camp off Old Hendersonville Highway Friday at the invitation of former County Commissioner Mike Hawkins, whose family founded the popular local restaurant in 1968. The building sustained massive flooding from the Sept. 26 storms and began the process of repairing water-logged flooring and flood-damaged walls Tuesday, but the restaurant may not reopen until the Christmas holidays.
‚ÄúThis is the twelfth or thirteenth county that I‚Äôve been in and the devastation has been catastrophic, but the determination and courage of the people of western North Carolina has been indescribable in that it has been so very strong. The commitment to build back better, stronger and more resilient is ever-present. What‚Äôs happening is a coordinated, massive effort that is unprecedented in North Carolina.‚Äù
As of Friday morning, officials with the Federal Emergency Management Agency said they have already approved 1,200 households in Transylvania County for individual assistance and $1.4 million directly to local survivors of the storm with more assistance on the way.
‚ÄúSmall businesses are the backbone of our economy and this is such an unprecedented crisis that we need to do more than that,‚Äù Cooper said. ‚ÄúI want to work in a bi-partisan way with the State Legislature and Congress to come up with some kind of grant program for our small businesses because many of them are looking at devastation and have to decide if they are going to rebuild. We want to help them in a more resilient way because we want them to stay here and we want them to be here.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis was a tremendously massive storm impacting a lot of communities all the way through the Gulf Coast and through North Carolina and Tennessee as well,‚Äù said FEMA Deputy Director Erik Hooks as he stood beside Cooper in the fish camp parking lot. ‚ÄúDespite the fact that we‚Äôve had to deal with Hurricane Milton, the work is ongoing for western North Carolina and we‚Äôll continue to be with you throughout the entire time.
‚ÄúThe president and vice-president have been unambiguously clear that the full weight of the federal government will be here for this great governor and this great community.‚Äù
As local elected officials and county staff thanked the governor for coming to Pisgah Forest, they also shared their appreciation for the ongoing support state agencies directed to Transylvania County at a time when many other neighboring communities were wrecked by Helene‚Äôs unrelenting wrath even more than what was experienced in Transylvania County.
‚ÄúFirst and foremost, we are so thankful that we did not lose any lives in the storm and that is partially due to support from Emergency Management,‚Äù said Transylvania County Manager Jaime Laughter. ‚ÄúWe put in an early request for two swift water rescue teams and two high-clearance vehicles. We know that saved some of our citizens‚Äô lives and some of our first responders‚Äô lives.‚Äù
‚ÄúTransylvania County is very lucky and very blessed that our facilities did not sustain any major damage,‚Äù School Superintendent Lisa Fletcher told Cooper. ‚ÄúWe are all accounted for and we are so excited to go back Monday. We are really blessed compared to our brothers and sisters around us.‚Äù
Brevard Mayor Maureen Copelof shared with Cooper that the downtown area was largely spared the brunt of the storm, but explained that it did not escape without its own set of ongoing challenges created by the flood waters.
‚ÄúWe have housing areas where we have displaced families. We have a trailer park that was pretty much wiped out. We have houses where the water was 6-feet high,‚Äù Copelof said. ‚ÄúWe had to take 58 people out of home by raft in the middle of the hurricane and our first responders did that safely, but it‚Äôs going to be a long recovery. Even though you don‚Äôt see that much damage everywhere, people have lost so much. Those who have lost their homes tend to be a lot of lower-income families. We already had an issue here with affordable housing. This has just really compounded the problem.‚Äù
She also praised the cooperative work between so many city, county and state agencies at a time when assistance was so desperately needed.
‚ÄúEven though we have had trauma and suffering, I look out with such pride how the county and the city have stood together, how the different state agencies and our faith organizations have stood up,‚Äù Copelof said. ‚ÄúWe have had such a massive effort to feed people and we have come through it. We have survived and we are going to move forward, but we are going to need a lot of help. That is why I am so glad that you are here today because you are going to be hearing from us and we will need assistance. There‚Äôs just no way around it. People are hurting and we need to take care of our people.‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you pointed out this disaster is so much different than the disasters we‚Äôve seen across the country,‚Äù Cooper responded. ‚ÄúIt is really unprecedented and it‚Äôs really complex because of the topography and the way the water flows here, but one thing that remains constant across the country is that those who get hit hardest are those who can afford it the least.
‚ÄúThat is something we want to put at a priority as well. I know it‚Äôs going to be a massive effort here and it‚Äôs going to require a massive investment. Billions and billions of dollars is what it‚Äôs going to take, but I‚Äôm hearing from people on both sides of that aisle that they‚Äôre ready to make that commitment.‚Äù
Tags Federal Emergency Management Agency Emergency Management Natural Disasters Natural Events Disasters Humanitarian Crises Transylvania County, North Carolina Atmospheric Circulation Atlantic Hurricanes Tropical Cyclones Weather Events Storms Atlantic Hurricane Seasons Natural Hazards Vortices Meteorology Tropical Meteorology Tropical Cyclone Seasons Pacific Hurricanes Tropics Climate Of The United States Storm Synoptic Meteorology And Weather Seasons Branches Of Meteorology North Carolina Trending Video Recommended for you Trending Recipes Obituaries Billie Jo Farmer Mooney

author: Keith Kelly
title: Ireland weather: Wet and windy weekend ahead as new Met Eireann warnings come into effect - Irish Mirror Online
text: Storm Gerrit may have come and gone, but it appears that the country will continue to experience yet more unsettled weather conditions this weekend in the lead up to the [New Year.](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/new-year) It had been reported earlier this week that [Ireland could be hit by the tail end of Storm Henk](https://www.irishmirror.ie/news/ireland-facing-prospect-another-storm-31754508) which was set to peak out over the Atlantic, but could still "pack a punch" on Ireland, according to weather expert Alan O'Reilly of the Carlow Weather page on X (formerly This forecast appears to be coming true for much of the country - the west and the south in particular - as [Met √âireann](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/met-eireann) has put Status Yellow rain and wind warnings in place for Friday and Saturday respectively. The national forecaster officially marked the northwestern counties of [Donegal](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/donegal), [Leitrim](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/leitrim), [Sligo](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/sligo) and North [Mayo](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/mayo) with a Status Yellow rain warning as heavy rainfall is due with a risk of flooding possible, valid from 6am to 9pm on Friday. Read More: [Ireland live lightning tracker as weather warnings issued and Met Eireann names 'hotspots'](https://www.irishmirror.ie/news/irish-news/ireland-live-lightning-tracker-weather-31761995) Carlow Weather's Alan O'Reilly says that up to 30mm of rainfall is possible over a 24-hour period in these counties in line with the Status Yellow warning. A separate Status Yellow wind warning is in place in the south going into Saturday too, as [Cork](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/cork), [Kerry](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/kerry), [Waterford](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/waterford) and [Wexford](https://www.irishmirror.ie/all-about/wexford) are earmarked to receive "strong to gale force and gusty" winds, leading to potential coastal flooding when coupled with high Spring tides. The warning comes into effect between 2am to 12pm on Saturday. Met √âireann's forecast the weekend is as follows, starting with Friday: "Windy at first this morning with fresh to strong and gusty westerly winds, gradually easing. There will be sunny periods and some showers for much of the country, some of which will be heavy. However, showery rain will persist in parts of the north and northwest for much of the day with some localised flooding likely and a chance of a little sleet in the north too. Highest temperatures of 4 to 8 degrees, possibly a little lower in some northern parts." "Some clear spells at first tonight with just isolated showers. Lowest temperatures of -1 to +3 degrees with some frost and icy stretches forming with light to moderate southwesterly or variable breezes." The forecast shows a similar outlook for Saturday: "A wet and windy start to the day with widespread rain, heavy or thundery at times with some localised flooding possible. The rain will clear to sunny spells and showers from the western half of the country through the morning, extending to all areas through the afternoon. "Some showers will be heavy with a chance of isolated thunderstorms and hail. Highest afternoon temperatures of 5 to 9 degrees, coolest in the northwest. Fresh to strong and gusty southerly winds, with onshore gales, will mean there is a chance of coastal flooding in the south and southwest." Sunday - New Year's Eve - has can expect the following: "Breezy or windy with sunny spells and scattered showers and a chance of hail. Fresh to strong and gusty westerly or cyclonic variable winds will gradually decrease moderate to fresh and gusty through the day. Highest temperatures of 6 to 9 degrees generally." New Year's Eve revellers in particular will be interested in the Sunday night forecast: "Showers will continue overnight, mainly for Atlantic counties with longer spells of rain possible in the northwest. Some frost or ice will form with lowest temperatures of 0 to 4 degrees in mostly moderate westerly winds." The outlook for Monday is: "Sunny spells and scattered showers at first, becoming more isolated through the morning and early afternoon. Cloud will build from the southwest later. Highest temperatures of 5 to 8 degrees in light to moderate southwest winds, backing southerly and falling mostly light later." Met √âireann says Tuesday will see outbreaks of rain and drizzle in the south will clear through the morning, becoming dry until night with some showers and highest temperatures of 3C to 6C degrees. Join the Irish Mirror‚Äôs breaking news service on WhatsApp. Click [this link](https://chat.whatsapp.com/FYsKkdmyzYm0dTbcSalI9S) to receive breaking news and the latest headlines direct to your phone. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don‚Äôt like our community, you can check out any time you like. If you‚Äôre curious, you can read our [Privacy Notice](https://www.reachplc.com/site-services/privacy-policy).

author: Riddhima Kanetkar
title: 'Court has taught lesson to...': AAP reacts after Delhi CM Kejriwal gets interim bail in ED case
text: India Saurabh Bhardwaj, Minister of Health, Urban Development, Tourism, Art and Culture, took to his social media handle on platform X and posted "First, Judge Nyay Bindu granted bail in the ED case, and now the country's biggest court has granted interim bail to Arvind Kejriwal." The Supreme Court granted interim bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the now scrapped excise policy case registered by the Enforcement Directorate today (ED). The Delhi CM however will continue to remain in jail as he was arrested by the CBI in the same case. The AAP celebrated the bail order saying that if the Centre acts arbitrarily its pride would be shattered. Saurabh Bhardwaj, Minister of Health, Urban Development, Tourism, Art and Culture, took to his social media handle on platform X and posted "First, Judge Nyay Bindu granted bail in the ED case, and now the country's biggest court has granted interim bail to Arvind Kejriwal." Further, he added, "The court has taught a big lesson to the Central BJP government. If the centre still acts, arbitrarily, the pride will be further shattered." Delhi Minister Atishi said, "...BJP knew that he (Arvind Kejriwal) has been granted bail by the Rouse Avenue Court, they know that he will get bail by the Supreme Court too. That is why, they hatched another conspiracy, and on the day on which the bail hearing was scheduled to come up before the Supreme Court, they made CBI arrest Arvind Kejriwal a day before that. Why was he arrested by the CBI? Because if he received bail in the ED case, he would come out of jail and work for the people of Delhi 10 times faster... I would like to tell the BJP today, one after the other - every court in this country has exposed your conspiracy... every court is granting bail to Arvind Kejriwal. I would like to tell the BJP, to end your arrogance and stop hatching conspiracy against other parties. Truth can be troubled but not defeated..." However, the BJP hit out at the AAP saying interim bail was not a relief from the crime committed. BJP MP Kamaljeet Sehrawat said, "Interim Bail is not a relief from the crime that one has committed. Interim Bail provides for one to stay out of jail as the case proceeds. But it doesn't mean that Arvind Kejriwal has not done a scam, that he was not involved in corruption... Perhaps the Supreme Court has allowed him to be out and work as the people of Delhi are suffering. But the court has not acquitted him." Kejriwal's lawyer, Rishikesh Kumar, described the verdict as a "big victory.". "The Supreme Court has granted him interim bail and the issue of Section 19 and the necessity of arrest have been referred to a larger bench. CM Kejriwal will remain in custody as his bail in the CBI case is still pending. This is a big victory," Kumar told ANI. Additionally, SC lawyer Shadan Farsat, representing Kejriwal, also said, "The court observed that so far as his arrest is concerned, there are certain aspects of the necessity of the arrest. They said Mr Kejriwal has already undergone a large period of incarceration and therefore, directed his release and bail immediately in the ED matter." The top court had reserved the verdict on Kejriwal's plea on May 17. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by DNA staff and is published from ANI) [READ | Nepal: 65 people including 7 Indians believed to be missing after two buses get swept away by landslide](https://www.dnaindia.com/world/report-nepal-65-people-including-7-indians-believed-to-be-missing-after-two-buses-get-swept-away-by-landslide-3096550)

author: NULL
title: USA: Catholics Make a Positive Impact by Showing Solidarity with the Church in Latin America
text: (ZENIT News / Washington, 12.28.2023).- Catholics in the United States will have an opportunity to show solidarity and share their faith by giving to the U.S. Conference of Catholic Bishops‚Äô (USCCB) annual Collection for the Church in Latin America next month. Last year, the collection delivered more than $6.5 million in grants to help people who reside in regions where poverty, political and religious persecution, and other hardships make it difficult for the Church to support itself. ‚ÄúIn an era with too much focus on what divides us from our sisters and brothers in Latin America, Catholics across the United States continue to strengthen our bonds of faith, hope, and love through their gifts to the U.S. bishops‚Äô annual Collection for the Church in Latin America,‚Äù said Bishop Octavio Cisneros, emeritus auxiliary bishop of Brooklyn and chairman of the USCCB Subcommittee on the Church in Latin America. Last year, this collection funded 251 grants supporting evangelization, catechesis, family ministry, pro-life work and outreach to groups as diverse as prisoners, university students, and Indigenous communities; sponsoring the formation of seminarians, clergy and those in consecrated life; as well as for emergency disaster relief after hurricanes, earthquakes and floods. - In the Diocese of Itztapalpa, Mexico, where hunger drives high rates of crime and incarceration, the Collection for the Church in Latin America supported an evangelization center where newly released convicts receive practical help with job-hunting, along with spiritual and emotional support and opportunities for recreation. - In Brazil, where persons of African ancestry suffer racial discrimination, the National Conference of Bishops of Brazil obtained a grant to engage Afro-Brazilian Catholic leaders in helping the Church more effectively promote and live Pope Francis‚Äô vision for loving our neighbors. - In Peru, a grant to the Prelature of Chuquibambilla in the Andes supported alliances between Church leaders, healthcare organizations and law enforcement to teach church workers how to prevent, report and respond to suspected abuse of children and vulnerable adults. - In Colombia, the Sisters of the Eucharistic Communicators of the Heavenly Father are teaching the Bible, Catholic doctrine, spirituality, and family life-skills, such as budgeting, to families in spiritual and material need with funding from the collection. Many dioceses will take the collection in their parishes on January 28. [#iGiveCatholicTogether](https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=4tNED-2FM8iDZJQyQ53jATUYF1v1ZgbMPcYtwtnJtNYbcYlsI8TQz45toRne9nSHg4edUHU-2BGr2k5mLeEcCvOtGO78j9LTwa4mJabN8L-2BnPIipj3zmMYQ2mSALhguxuzoZgU9a_SZ5CJp4ZI-2FOFlCzqmjU-2F9sap7Bsp7yyrDoi3i9KVX8nTpMsAX3T7bK0DEJ-2B8mD-2BqEyN97mi45alv1JYVXjy4h1q4FHM5hC9AQLzCzB9OsUeZHBx49H9lHMDBmm-2Bjxdgx5arFT-2FR8EfmceXsRc8slfdw-2Fiqyixmvv5REt5CJl2MW-2FIFjD3lR2PNhajK589LAD719kuw-2BtHRxbwsGNoO4zFKUSUXaDSbOBq2rMxXc9vPGUKezg-2FgwxbueDZ2WVDri43PF2lKDnxZ2b6WJNADNPJWw4EQ6HBUYnW2Cbium0NKcjH7q8hulPaRXvbTwPQzPHnrM3kuqq09WDkrQOWpUP3GaXy0cLBmpHHVnqfnExDHs-3D) also accepts funds for the collection. For more information see [www.usccb.org/latin-america](https://u7061146.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=TeZUXWpUv-2B6TCY38pVLo9plRFZzTseXQOZhu2kANIpC7Al-2FD6PHP5XOsfSGEERiJpdDB_SZ5CJp4ZI-2FOFlCzqmjU-2F9sap7Bsp7yyrDoi3i9KVX8nTpMsAX3T7bK0DEJ-2B8mD-2BqEyN97mi45alv1JYVXjy4h1q4FHM5hC9AQLzCzB9OsUeZHBx49H9lHMDBmm-2Bjxdgx5arFT-2FR8EfmceXsRc8slfdw-2Fiqyixmvv5REt5CJl2MW-2FIFjD3lR2PNhajK589LADrcNPFmfDKExBSrvSsSSwHdEmY9fAPSPVVsc0ADK99uOJP4a-2F1o8NtYOYxkwsV8ZTIHlYIdbzmGNwTPDR6KDaj5EK56y-2BoMO-2B9-2Fr2YNsPhWUYarvbgxaPZJt1nokRaFQqte5vq2SamSxEnkJCODl-2BUS9Gz-2BYi9hcy-2FqGMmU9xh1U-3D).

author: hellenicshippingnews...
title: Iron ore futures slide amid weak China factory activity outlook | Hellenic Shipping News Worldwide
text:
Dalian iron ore futures declined on Thursday as market participants geared up for a sustained contraction in manufacturing activity in China.
The most-traded May iron ore on China‚Äôs Dalian Commodity Exchange DCIOcv1 was down 1.3% at 976 yuan ($137.48) per metric ton at closing.
On the Singapore Exchange, the benchmark January iron ore SZZFF4 was down 1.8% at $141.24 a ton, snapping a five-day winning streak.
China‚Äôs manufacturing activity likely contracted for the third consecutive month in December, a Reuters poll showed, weighed by soft demand for manufactured goods, a reading that would embolden calls for more policy support.
The country will strive to expand domestic demand, ensure a speedy economic recovery and promote stable growth, according to an interim report of the country‚Äôs 14th five-year plan published by parliament on Wednesday.
As part of the plan, China will intensify market-oriented reforms to boost development.
China‚Äôs yuan CNY= firmed against a weakening U.S. dollar on Thursday after the dollar index fell late on Wednesday to its lowest level in five months.
A stronger yuan makes yuan-denominated assets less affordable when purchased in other currencies.
Analysts expect demand for iron ore to surge in coming weeks as Chinese steelmakers replenish raw materials to maintain production needs over the Lunar New Year holiday break.
Steel benchmarks on the Shanghai Futures Exchange were mixed. The most-active rebar contract SRBcv1 slid 0.4%, hot-rolled coil SHHCcv1 dropped 0.7%, and wire rod SWRcv1 fell 0.6%. Meanwhile, stainless steel SHSScv1 gained 0.4%.
Other steelmaking ingredients Dalian coking coal DJMcv1 and coke DCJcv1 inched down 2.4% and 0.9%, respectively.
Source: Reuters (Reporting by Ashley Fang; Editing by Sonia Cheema and Subhranshu Sahu)
2023-12-29 hellenicshippingnews...

author: R.J. POST York News-Times
title: Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend
text:
Top Story Editor's Pick Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend R.J. Post Jan 2, 2025 Jan 2, 2025 Updated 2 hrs ago 0 A sidewalk cleaner works on Friday in Lincoln.
KENNETH FERRIERA, Journal Star Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save R.J. Post With a significant winter storm possible this weekend, the National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a winter storm watch for York and a large portion of southeast Nebraska.
The watch will be in effect from noon Saturday through 6 p.m. Sunday.
Light freezing drizzle, snow and blowing snow could impact the area. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze are possible.
The weather service describes the affected area as including portions of north-central Kansas and east-central and south-central Nebraska.
Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below a half-mile due to falling and blowing snow on Saturday and Sunday.
Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts
Preceding the storm, Friday should be mostly cloudy with a high near 26 and mild winds.
People are also reading‚Ä¶ York County Sheriff‚Äôs Office arrests driver with 0.256% blood alcohol content Nebraska inmate sues over access to son conceived with staff member Nebraska State Patrol, U.S. marshals arrest murder suspect near Goehner York‚Äôs Keagyn Linden at 15-0 grabs No. 1 spot in area boys wrestling rankings 'A magical day' ‚Äî Four Corners Health Department begins using 28 remodeled rooms A 2024 York Business Beat recap 16-year-old boy dies of injuries from 'car surfing' incident in Lexington Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend Central City man died in New Year's Eve crash near Grand Island, sheriff says Nebraska man who lost his home over $588 debt is getting it back Nebraska AG fighting order for State Patrol to give information in civil lawsuit Snowblazers program keeps York kids busy during holiday break Duke girls stifle the Stars at Amherst Nebraska players relish quirks of Pinstripe Bowl in all its soaked, lawnmower-themed glory Update: Death toll hits 15; FBI says driver in truck attack likely didn't act alone But Saturday will bring a 30 percent chance of snow, mainly after noon, and a high near 20 degrees. The forecast calls for new snow accumulations of less than a half-inch in York on Saturday.
Things could really become blustery overnight Saturday with a low around 8 degrees and a 90% chance of precipitation. Patchy, blowing snow is forecast after 3 a.m.
Sunday‚Äôs forecast includes a 50 percent chance of snow, mainly before noon, and areas of blowing snow before 5 p.m. The high is predicted to be near 13, followed by an overnight low of 2 below zero.
Monday should be mostly sunny with a high near 14 degrees.
R.J. Post is a reporter for the York News-Times. Reach him at rjpost@yorknewstimes.com .
